actions-list.actionItem: The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 787.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Williams (TX) moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended. H.R. 787 — "To require plain language and the inclusion of key words in covered notices that are clear, concise, and accessible to small business concerns, and for other purposes."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 1816.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Williams (TX) moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended. H.R. 1816 — "To establish requirements relating to certification of small business concerns owned and controlled by women for certain purposes, and for other purposes."

At the conclusion of debate, the Yeas and Nays were demanded and ordered. Pursuant to the provisions of clause 8, rule XX, the Chair announced that further proceedings on the motion would be postponed.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 1642.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Williams (TX) moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill. H.R. 1642 — "To amend the Small Business Act to include requirements relating to graduates of career and technical education programs for small business development centers and women's business centers, and for other purposes."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 3490.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
Mr. Comer moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended. H.R. 3490 — "To require the Government Accountability Office to produce a report on esophageal cancer, and for other purposes."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on S. 160.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Comer moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill. S. 160 — "To amend the Wildfire Suppression Aircraft Transfer Act of 1996 to reauthorize the sale by the Department of Defense of aircraft and parts for wildfire suppression purposes, and for other purposes."
The Speaker announced that votes on suspensions, if ordered, will be postponed until a time to be announced.
The House convened, returning from a recess continuing the legislative day of June 3.
The Speaker announced that the House do now recess. The next meeting is subject to the call of the Chair.
The House proceeded with one minute speeches.
The Chair designated Mr. Moylan to lead the Members in reciting the Pledge of Allegiance to the Flag.
The Speaker announced approval of the Journal.  Pursuant to clause 1, rule I, the Journal stands approved.
Today's prayer was offered by the House Chaplain, Chaplain Margaret Grun Kibben.
The House convened, returning from a recess continuing the legislative day of June 3.
The Speaker announced that the House do now recess. The next meeting is scheduled for 2:00 P.M. today.
The House proceeded with Morning-Hour Debate. At the conclusion of Morning-Hour, the House will recess until 2:00 p.m. for the start of legislative business.
The Speaker designated the Honorable David J. Taylor to act as Speaker pro tempore for today.
The House convened, starting a new legislative day.
